Mount Abu, Rajasthan - A beautiful hill station in Rajasthan 4.3 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Dilwara Temples (Delwada Temple) Toad Rock Mount Abu Sunset Point Mount Abu, Rajasthan's only hill station, offers a cool retreat amid the arid landscape, boasting serene lakes, verdant forests, and ancient temples. Perched in the Aravalli Range, this oasis draws tourists with its captivating beauty and rich history.How to reach from Jaipur: The most common routes include driving, which takes about 7-8 hours, or taking a bus. Alternatively, one can take a train to Abu Road station (the closest rail link) and then travel the remaining 28 km to Mount Abu by taxi or bus. Distance from Jaipur: 495 km Best Time: October to March 20 Mount Abu Attractions View Packages Read More 2. Ranakpur, Rajasthan - A Spiritual Oasis in Aravali 4.1 /5 View 33+ photos Known For : Ranakpur Jain Temple Sadri Surya Narayan Temple Ranakpur, nestled in Rajasthan, is famed for its grand Jain Temple, dedicated to Tirthankara Adinatha, distinguished by its intricate carvings and an astonishing 1,444 uniquely adorned pillars. This architectural wonder is a testament to ancient craftsmanship and religious devotion.How to Reach from Jaipur: Ranakpur is roughly 360 km from Jaipur. A drive through Rajasthan's scenic landscapes takes about 5-6 hours by car or bus. Distance from Jaipur: 359 km Best Time: October to March 7 Ranakpur Attractions View Packages Read More 3. Morni Hills 4.0 /5 Morni Hills, situated in Haryana, stands as the state's sole hill station, presenting panoramic views of the Shivalik range. Renowned for its twin interconnected lakes and a diverse array of flora and fauna, it's a favored spot for trekkers, bird enthusiasts, and nature lovers.How to Reach from Jaipur: The journey via road traversing through Rajasthan and Haryana's plains takes approximately 8-9 hours by car. Direct buses might be limited, so it's advisable to check schedules or consider driving. Distance from Jaipur: 515 km Read More 4. Shimla, Himachal Pradesh - The Hill-Station with Rich Colonial History 4.8 /5 View 24+ photos Known For : Jakhu Temple Mall Road, Shimla Rashtrapati Niwas (Viceregal Lodge) Shimla, perched amidst the Himalayas, is Himachal Pradesh's capital and showcases a harmonious blend of colonial architecture and modern amenities. Its dynamic Mall Road, iconic Ridge, and age-old edifices, coupled with its temperate weather, make it a top hill station for tourists.How to Reach from Jaipur:  Traveling by road typically takes around 12-14 hours by car. While there are no direct buses, one can opt for trains or flights to Delhi and then proceed to Shimla. Rishikesh, Uttarakhand - Yoga Capital of the World 4.5 /5 View 37+ photos Known For : Triveni Ghat Rafting in Rishikesh Lakshman Jhula Rishikesh, in Uttarakhand, is revered as the "Yoga Capital of the World." Positioned alongside the sacred Ganges River, it offers both spiritual solace with its plethora of yoga and meditation retreats, and adrenaline-pumping adventure, courtesy of white-water rafting.How to Reach from Jaipur: By road, the journey takes approximately 10-12 hours by car. Though direct bus services might be limited, trains to Haridwar followed by a short drive or bus to Rishikesh are viable options. Distance from Jaipur: 530 km Best Time: Throughout the year 54 Rishikesh Attractions View Packages Read More 6. Kufri, Himachal Pradesh 4.0 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Himalayan Nature Park (Kufri Zoo) Skiing in Kufri Mahasu Peak Kufri, located in Himachal Pradesh, is a picturesque hill station renowned for its invigorating mountain air, lush green landscapes, and captivating hiking trails. Often overshadowed by its neighbor, Shimla, Kufri holds its own charm with attractions like the Himalayan Nature Park and the annual winter sports festival.How to Reach from Jaipur: The road journey takes around 13-15 hours by car. Direct bus services might be limited; travelers can consider driving or taking a train to Chandigarh or Shimla, followed by a taxi ride to Kufri. Distance from Jaipur: 620 km Best Time: November to March 12 Kufri Attractions View Packages Read More 7. Auli, Uttarakhand - The skiing destination of India 4.3 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Auli Ropeway Skiing in Auli Joshimath Auli, nestled in the state of Uttarakhand, is a pristine hill station renowned for its majestic snow-covered peaks and being a prime skiing destination in India. With its sprawling ski slopes, vibrant apple orchards, and panoramic views of the Himalayas, Auli is a haven for both adventurers and those seeking tranquility.How to Reach from Jaipur: The road journey takes approximately 18-20 hours by car. Given the long distance, it might be preferable to take a train or flight to Dehradun or Rishikesh and then hire a cab or take a bus to Joshimath, followed by a ropeway or another short drive to Auli. Distance from Jaipur: 799 km Best Time: December - February 12 Auli Attractions View Packages Read More 8. Nainital, Uttarakhand - Misty lakes and mountains 4.4 /5 View 36+ photos Known For : Naini Lake Snow View Point Mall Road Nainital Nainital, perched in the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand, is a quintessential hill station celebrated for its iconic pear-shaped lake and colonial architecture. Surrounded by verdant hills and dotted with charming British-era bungalows and churches, Nainital offers a refreshing mix of nature and history.How to Reach from Jaipur:  The journey by road takes about 11-13 hours by car. While direct buses are available, another option for travelers is to take a train to Kathgodam, the nearest railway station to Nainital, and then continue the short journey by taxi or bus. Distance from Jaipur: 594 km Best Time: Throughout the year 33 Nainital Attractions View Packages Read More 9. Almora, Uttarakhand - A cozy heritage town nestled in the Himalayas. 4.3 /5 View 20+ photos Known For : Jageshwar Dunagiri Kasar Devi Temple Almora, set in Uttarakhand, stands out as a captivating hill station adorned with colonial architecture, rich cultural heritage, and panoramic Himalayan views. The town's terraced fields, vibrant local markets, and ancient temples provide a genuine experience of the Kumaoni lifestyle and traditions.How to Reach from Jaipur: The road journey, generally takes around 12-14 hours by car. For those opting for public transport, taking a train to Kathgodam and then availing a taxi or bus to Almora is a viable option. Distance from Jaipur: 658 km Best Time: Throughout the year 16 Almora Attractions View Packages Read More 10. Mussoorie, Uttarakhand - The queen of hill-stations 4.8 /5 View 31+ photos Known For : Mussoorie Mall Road Lal Tibba Kempty Falls Mussoorie, affectionately termed the 'Queen of the Hills', is a prominent hill station in Uttarakhand, well-known for its colonial charm, winding lanes, and spectacular views of the Doon Valley. The lush green hills, varied flora and fauna, and the shimmering Doon Valley and Shivalik ranges make it an alluring destination for tourists.How to Reach from Jaipur: A road trip will take approximately 14-16 hours by car. If one prefers a combination of rail and road, they can take a train to Dehradun, the nearest major railway station, and then continue the remaining 35 km to Mussoorie by taxi or bus. Distance from Jaipur: 582 km Best Time: September to June 36 Mussoorie Attractions View Packages Read More 11. Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh - Cozy little hill-station 4.2 /5 View 22+ photos Known For : Monkey Point Toy Train Ride Timber Trail Kasauli, nestled in Himachal Pradesh, is a serene hill station characterized by its colonial-era architecture, cobbled roads, and dense forests. This quaint town, with its peaceful ambiance and spectacular views of the surrounding hills, provides a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.How to Reach from Jaipur: The drive takes approximately 11-13 hours by car. For travelers opting for public transport, taking a train to Kalka, the nearest railway station to Kasauli, and then hiring a taxi or using local transport for the uphill journey is a recommended option. Distance from Jaipur: 551 km Best Time: March - June; September - November 13 Kasauli Attractions View Packages Read More 12. Dehradun, Uttarakhand - Winter Capital of Uttarakhand 4.3 /5 View 34+ photos Known For : Robber's Cave Mindrolling Monastery Tapkeshwar Temple Dehradun, the capital city of Uttarakhand, lies nestled in the Doon Valley, framed by the Ganges and Yamuna rivers on either side. With its reputed educational institutions, pleasant weather, and nearby tourist attractions like the Robber's Cave and Tapkeshwar Temple, it's a city that seamlessly blends urban life with natural beauty.How to Reach from Jaipur: A road journey takes around 9-11 hours by car. Alternatively, travelers can take a direct train from Jaipur to Dehradun, which provides a comfortable and convenient mode of transportation. Distance from Jaipur: 537 km Best Time: Throughout the year 38 Dehradun Attractions View Packages Read More 13. Lansdowne, Uttarakhand - Quaint little hilly town 4.6 /5 View 17+ photos Known For : Bhulla Lake Tip N Top Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple Lansdowne, positioned in Uttarakhand, is a tranquil hill station untouched by excessive commercialization. Originally a British cantonment, the town today is famous for its serene ambiance, colonial architecture, and panoramic vistas of the surrounding Himalayas.How to Reach from Jaipur: By road, it takes approximately 10-12 hours by car. Although there's no direct train between Jaipur and Lansdowne, one can take a train to Kotdwara, the nearest railway station, and then cover the remaining 40 km to Lansdowne by taxi or bus. Distance from Jaipur: 538 km Best Time: Throughout the year 14 Lansdowne Attractions View Packages Read More 14. Dhanaulti, Uttarakhand 4.8 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Dhanaulti Adventure Park Eco Park, Dhanaulti Apple Orchard Resort Dhanaulti, located in Uttarakhand, is a picturesque hill station known for its lush green alpine forests, rhododendron shrubs, and pleasant climate. Offering a serene ambiance away from crowded tourist spots, it is an ideal destination for those seeking solitude and a close encounter with nature.How to Reach from Jaipur: Dhanaulti is about 630 km from Jaipur. A road trip can take around 11-13 hours by car. There isn't a direct train between Jaipur and Dhanaulti. However, travelers can take a train to Dehradun, which is the nearest major railway station, and then hire a taxi or bus for the remaining journey to Dhanaulti, which is approximately 60 km away. Distance from Jaipur: 593 km Best Time: September to June 10 Dhanaulti Attractions View Packages Read More 15. Chail, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Chail wildlife sanctuary Camping Kali Temple, Chail Chail, settled in Himachal Pradesh, is a quiet hill station known for having the world's highest cricket ground and the heritage Chail Palace. Nestled amidst pine and deodar trees, it offers spectacular views of the valleys and is an ideal retreat from bustling city life.How to Reach from Jaipur: Chail is approximately 630 km from Jaipur. By road it takes roughly 10-12 hours by car. While there's no direct train link between Jaipur and Chail, one can take a train to Kalka or Chandigarh, the nearest major railway stations, and then opt for a taxi or bus to cover the remaining distance to Chail. Distance from Jaipur: 571 km Best Time: Throughout the year 11 Chail Attractions View Packages Read More 16. Narkanda, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Skiing in Narkanda Hatu Peak Hatu Mata Temple Narkanda, perched in Himachal Pradesh, is a serene hill station renowned for its apple orchards, ancient temples, and panoramic views of the snow-clad Himalayan ranges. Apart from its natural beauty, Narkanda is also a popular destination for skiing in winters.How to Reach from Jaipur: Narkanda is roughly 670 km from Jaipur. Traveling by road takes about 11-13 hours by car. There isn't a direct train route from Jaipur to Narkanda. However, the nearest significant railway station is Shimla. Travelers can take a train to Shimla and then proceed with a taxi or bus for the 60 km journey to Narkanda. Distance from Jaipur: 633 km Best Time: Throughout the year 11 Narkanda Attractions View Packages Read More 17. Ranikhet, Uttarakhand - The Queen's Farm 4.3 /5 View 19+ photos Known For : Chaubatia Orchards Majhkhali Golf Course Ranikhet, located in the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand, is a picturesque hill station characterized by its lush green forests, mesmerizing meadows, and stunning views of the Himalayas. Often referred to as the 'Queen's Meadow,' Ranikhet offers a perfect blend of nature and colonial heritage, providing a tranquil retreat for visitors.How to Reach from Jaipur: Ranikhet is approximately 650 km away from Jaipur. The road journey takes around 12-14 hours by car. Though there's no direct train connectivity between Jaipur and Ranikhet, one can take a train to Kathgodam, which is the nearest railway station. From Kathgodam, a taxi or bus can be availed for the remaining 80 km to reach Ranikhet. Distance from Jaipur: 629 km Best Time: Throughout the year 22 Ranikhet Attractions View Packages Read More 18. Mcleodganj, Himachal Pradesh - Land of His Holiness the Dalai Lama - Little Lhasa 4.2 /5 View 19+ photos Known For : Naddi View Point St. John in the Wilderness Church Dalai Lama Temple Mcleodganj, nestled in Himachal Pradesh, is often known as 'Little Lhasa' due to its significant Tibetan population. This vibrant town, a suburb of Dharamshala, is famous for its monasteries, Tibetan culture, and the residence of His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama.How to Reach from Jaipur: Mcleodganj is around 950 km from Jaipur. The road journey typically takes about 16-18 hours by car. While there isn't a direct train from Jaipur to Mcleodganj, one can take a train to Pathankot or Kangra, the nearest railway stations. From there, a taxi or bus can be taken to cover the remaining distance to Mcleodganj. Distance from Jaipur: 705 km Best Time: October to June 42 Mcleodganj Attractions View Packages Read More 19. Pachmarhi, Madhya Pradesh - Queen of the Satpuras 4.1 /5 View 16+ photos Known For : Bee falls Jata Shankar caves Pandava Caves Pachmarhi, often referred to as the "Queen of Satpura," is the sole hill station in Madhya Pradesh. Nestled amidst the Satpura range, this UNESCO Biosphere Reserve is famed for its picturesque waterfalls, ancient caves, and diverse flora and fauna, offering a tranquil retreat away from the hustle and bustle.How to Reach from Jaipur: Pachmarhi is roughly 900 km from Jaipur. By road the journey typically takes around 14-16 hours by car. There is no direct train connectivity between Jaipur and Pachmarhi. However, one can take a train to Pipariya, which is the nearest railway station to Pachmarhi. From Pipariya, it's about a 50 km drive, easily covered by taxis or local buses. Distance from Jaipur: 806 km Best Time: Throughout the year 18 Pachmarhi Attractions View Packages Read More 20. Kasol, Himachal Pradesh 4.5 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Manikaran Sahib Nature Park Kasol Tosh Kasol, settled in the Parvati Valley of Himachal Pradesh, is a haven for backpackers, trekkers, and nature enthusiasts. Often referred to as the 'Amsterdam of India', Kasol is renowned for its picturesque landscapes, vibrant cafés, and as a base point for several treks, including the famous Kheerganga trek.How to Reach from Jaipur: Kasol is approximately 800 km from Jaipur. The road journey typically takes about 14-16 hours by car. While there's no direct rail link to Kasol, the nearest major railway station is Bhuntar, around 31 km away. From Bhuntar, one can easily hire a taxi or take local buses to reach Kasol. Distance from Jaipur: 709 km Best Time: October to June 30 Kasol Attractions View Packages Read More 21. Manali, Himachal Pradesh - Lover's Paradise - India's Honeymoon capital 4.8 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Solang Valley Hadimba Devi Temple Manali Mall Road Manali, located in the Kullu Valley of Himachal Pradesh, is one of India's most sought-after hill stations. Blessed with snow-capped peaks, dense pine forests, and the meandering Beas River, it's a haven for adventurers, honeymooners, and nature enthusiasts alike.How to Reach from Jaipur: Manali is about 800 km away from Jaipur. Typically, a road journey would take around 15-17 hours. Alternatively, one can take a train or flight to Chandigarh, the nearest major city, and then proceed by road (approximately 8-9 hours) to Manali. Numerous buses, both private and state-run, also operate between Jaipur and Manali. Distance from Jaipur: 727 km Best Time: October to June 53 Manali Attractions View Packages Read More 22. Dalhousie, Himachal Pradesh - Little Switzerland of India 4.6 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Panchpula Dainkund Peak Beeji's Park Dalhousie, set amidst the scenic Dhauladhar mountain range in Himachal Pradesh, evokes the old-world charm of the British Raj. Characterized by its colonial architecture, pristine landscapes, and cool climate, it offers travelers a tranquil retreat in the lap of the Himalayas.How to Reach from Jaipur: Dalhousie is roughly 1,000 km away from Jaipur. A road journey would typically take around 18-20 hours. One convenient route is to take a train or flight to Pathankot, the nearest major railway station and airport, and then continue by road to Dalhousie, which is about 2.5 to 3 hours away. Direct buses between Jaipur and Dalhousie are limited, so it's recommended to check schedules or consider traveling via Chandigarh or Pathankot. Distance from Jaipur: 786 km Best Time: Throughout the year 29 Dalhousie Attractions View Packages Read More 23. Khajjiar, Himachal Pradesh - Mini Switzerland of India 4.6 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Khajjiar lake Homestay Experience in Khajjiar Kalatop Wildlife Sanctuary Khajjiar, often referred to as the "Mini Switzerland of India," is a picturesque hill station in Himachal Pradesh. Nestled amidst dense pine and deodar forests, its standout feature is a sublime saucer-shaped meadow, adorned with a serene lake in the center and surrounded by lush greenery.How to Reach from Jaipur: Khajjiar is approximately 1,030 km from Jaipur. The journey by road can take about 18-21 hours. It's most convenient to travel to Pathankot, the closest major railway station, by train from Jaipur and then hire a taxi or take a bus to Khajjiar, which is approximately 90 km away. Direct buses from Jaipur to Khajjiar are scarce, so it might be preferable to take a bus to Dalhousie or Chamba and then another short trip to Khajjiar.
